metadata.title: CVE-2021-32027 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in postgresql in versions before 13.3, before 12.7, before11.12, before 10.17 and before 9.6.22. While modifying certain SQL arrayvalues, missing bounds checks let authenticated database users writearbitrary bytes to a wide area of server memory. The highest threat fromthis vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well assystem availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32027` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
libecpg6 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
libpq5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
